attributes.action: Can we ask the government to get nhs self employed to be out of IR-35 rule
attributes.background: From Cleaner to Prime Ministrer , all can work through limited company, why can’t the nhs self employed, as we are a big part of nhs worker community as well , the regular employes should be able to work through limited company, as normal.

rejection.details:
We understand that you are unhappy with how the IR35 rules are affecting some people who provide services to the NHS, but it's not clear what action you want the Government to take to resolve this.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Revoke IR35 Legislation that is causing significant damage to UK businesses: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300458

Amend the IR35 Reforms to re-instate the 5% allowance for all contractors: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302056

If you want the Government to take an action that is not covered by the above, you could start a new petition stating clearly what you want the Government to do.
